_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Bozzuto's Inc.

400 Frontage Rd

North Haven, CT 06473



REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED / QUANTITY



Anhydrous Ammonia

22,600 lbs.



INTRODUCTION



Bozzuto's Inc. is a wholesale food distributor based in central Connecticut for over fifty years. In September of

2008 Bozzuto's moved into an existing refrigerated warehouse distribution center. Among its advantages, this

distribution center utilizes the benefits of ammonia as a refrigerant. Bozzuto's does recognize ammonia as a

hazardous chemical, and this was a consideration when selecting the facility. In consideration of the risks

associated with the use of ammonia, Bozzuto's commits its efforts to ensuring the employees and

surrounding community continue to enjoy a healthy and safe environment.

Part of this commitment includes:

- Employing only skilled refrigeration technicians;

- Contracting with only experienced ammonia refrigeration contractors;

- Organizing an in-house Emergency Support Team

- Coordination with the North Haven Fire Department;

- Partnering with a hazardous materials release contractor; and

- Maintaining communication with the designated North Haven Local Emergency Planning Commission.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION



Accidental release prevention is the approach Bozzuto's has taken to minimize and possibly eliminate the

potential for an accidental release. Bozzuto's exercises ongoing preventive maintenance and equipment

integrity procedures.

Some of these programs include:

- Process Safety Management / Risk Management

- Hazard Communication, and

- Lockout / Tagout



EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Bozzuto's maintains twenty-four hour, seven day per week coverage of trained Security Officers. In the event

of an emergency the notifier will dial an emergency extension and be connected to a Security Officer. The

Security Officer will gather the information and initiate the Emergency Action Plan.

Having this continuous coverage reduces the response time in an emergency con

dition, thereby minimizing the

consequences.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



Bozzuto's views the risk of accidental release very seriously. Accidental release prevention programs include:

- Process Safety Management / Risk Management,

- Hazard Communication,

- Lockout / Tagout.



Through a Process Hazard Analysis, Bozzuto's tries to identify potential accidental release conditions through

a Haz-Op study to identify risks. Solutions are then developed to prevent or limit these conditions from

happening.



If an incident were to happen, an investigation would take place, and new procedures would be implemented

so a similar occurrence could be prevented.



Bozzuto's prevention programs are audited at regular intervals to validate their effectiveness; the objective is

to be proactive in preventing accidental releases, not reactive.



Bozzuto's is not aware of any reportable release prior to taking occupancy in September 2008. With the

current practice of education, preventive maintenance, and commitment, Bozzuto's strives to minimize the

potential for accidents in the future.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN



Bozzuto's Emergency Response Plan is organized in multiple levels of response, many of which are by trained

Bozzuto's employees. The Emergency Support Team is the core of the action plan. This team is trained in the

Emergency Action Plan procedures and implementation. The Emergency Support Team meets to review

procedures and discuss new and improved methods of response. Among the benefits of having a trained in-house

support team is reduced response time and more immediate decision making capabilities; these

qualities greatly contribute to minimizing the effects in the event of an actual emergency.



The North Haven Fire Department is an important part of Bozzuto's Emergency Action Plan, and are kept

current with Bozzuto's facility information.



Bozzuto's continues to revise and improve its Emergency Action Plan. This effort is part o

f Bozzuto's

commitment to the health and safety of its employees and community.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Bozzuto's is continually looking for new ways of improving the safety level of its employees and community.

New and enhanced automatic detection and shutdown systems have been recently installed which provide

automatic response capability.



Bozzuto's continues to work with an experienced hazardous materials spill contractor. The intention of the

partnership is to provide Bozzuto's additional specific expertise in the field of hazardous materials release

procedures and prevention. Continuing discussions and exercises are planned to ensure an efficient and

prompt response time.



Bozzuto's is working with the regional New Haven Area Special Hazards Team to pre plan and coordinate

response scenarios.



Bozzuto's plans to continue its efforts and commitment to health and safety.
